50 #ifndef __lib_weatherfile_h
51 #define __lib_weatherfile_h
52 
53 #include <string>
54 #include <vector> // needed to compile in typelib_vc2012
55 #include <cmath>
56 
57 /***************************************************************************\
58 
59  Function humidity()
60  This function calculates the relative humidity(%) based on the drybulb
61  temperature(C) and the dewpoint temperature. It uses equations and
62  procedures presented in the 1993 ASHRAE Fundamentals Handbook, p6.7-10.
63  If humidity cannot be calculated an error value of 999 is returned.
64  1/4/00
65  List of Parameters Passed to Function:
66  db = dry bulb temperature in degrees C
67  dpt = dew point temperature in degrees C
68 
69  Variable Returned
70  rh = relative humidity in %, or error value of 999
71 
72 \***************************************************************************/
73 int calc_humidity(float db,float dpt);
74 
75 /* This function calculates the dewpoint temperature(C) based on the drybulb
76  temperature(C) and the relative humidity(%). It uses equations and
77  procedures presented in the 1993 ASHRAE Fundamentals Handbook, p6.7-10.
78  If dewpoint cannot be calculated an error value of 99.9 is returned.
79 
80  List of Parameters Passed to Function:
81  db = dry bulb temperature in degrees C
82  rh = relative humidity in %
83 
84  Variable Returned
85  dpt = dew point temperature in degrees C, or error value of 99.9 */
86 float calc_dewpt(float db,float rh);
87 
88 // Calculate wet bulb temperature from T (dry bulb, 'C), RH (%), Pressure (mbar)
89 // see http://www.ejournal.unam.mx/atm/Vol07-3/ATM07304.pdf for eqns.
90 double calc_twet( double T, double RH, double P );
91 
92 static inline double wiki_dew_calc(double T, double RH)
93 {
94  // ref: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dew_point
95 
96  if (RH > 0 && RH < 100)
97  {
98  static const double a = 17.271;
99  static const double b = 237.7;
100  double gamma = a*T / (b + T) + log(RH / 100.0);
101  double denom = a - gamma;
102  if (denom != 0.0)
103  return b*gamma / denom;
104  }
105 
106  // ultra-simple equation (OK as long as RH > 50%)
107  return T - (100 - RH) / 5;
108 };
109 
110 struct weather_header {
111  weather_header() { reset(); }
112  void reset();
113 
114  std::string location;
115  std::string city;
116  std::string state;
117  std::string country;
118  std::string source;
119  std::string description;
120  std::string url;
121  bool hasunits;
122  double tz;
123  double lat;
124  double lon;
125  double elev;
126 };
127 
128 struct weather_record {
129  weather_record() { reset(); }
130  void reset();
131 
132  int year;
133  int month;
134  int day;
135  int hour;
136  double minute;
137  double gh; // global (W/m2)
138  double dn; // direct (W/m2)
139  double df; // diffuse (W/m2)
140  double poa; // plane of array (W/m2)
141  double wspd; // wind speed (m/s)
142  double wdir; // wind direction (deg: N = 0 or 360, E = 90, S = 180,W = 270 )
143  double tdry; // dry bulb temp (C)
144  double twet; // wet bulb temp (C)
145  double tdew; // dew point temp (C)
146  double rhum; // relative humidity (%)
147  double pres; // pressure (mbar)
148  double snow; // snow depth (cm) 0-150
149  double alb; // ground reflectance 0-1. values outside this range mean it is not included
150  double aod; // aerosol optical depth
151 };
152 
153 class weather_data_provider
154 {
155 public:
156  enum { YEAR, MONTH, DAY, HOUR, MINUTE,
157  GHI, DNI, DHI, POA,
158  TDRY, TWET, TDEW,
159  WSPD, WDIR,
160  RH, PRES, SNOW, ALB, AOD,
161  _MAXCOL_ };
162 
163 protected:
164  bool m_ok;
165  bool m_msg;
166  int m_startYear;
167  double m_time;
168  // error messages
169  std::string m_message;
170 
171  size_t m_startSec;
172  size_t m_stepSec;
173  size_t m_nRecords;
174  size_t m_index;
175  bool m_hasLeapYear = false;
176 
177  weather_header m_hdr;
178  bool m_hdrInitialized;
179 
180 public:
181  weather_data_provider() : m_hdrInitialized( false ) { }
182  virtual ~weather_data_provider() { }
183 
184  bool header(weather_header *hdr)
185  {
186  if (!hdr) return false;
187  *hdr = m_hdr;
188  return true;
189  }
190  bool ok(){ return m_ok; }
191  size_t start_sec(){ return m_startSec; } // start time in seconds, 0 = jan 1st midnight
192  size_t step_sec(){ return m_stepSec; } // step time in seconds
193  size_t nrecords(){ return m_nRecords; } // number of data records in file
194  int get_counter_value(){ return (int)m_index; }
195  void rewind(){ m_index = 0; }
196 
198  void set_counter_to(size_t cur_index) {
199  if (cur_index < m_nRecords){
200  m_index = cur_index;
201  }
202  }
203 
204  bool has_message() { return m_message.size() > 0; }
205  std::string message() { return m_message; }
206 
207  double lat() { return header().lat; }
208  double lon() { return header().lon; }
209  double tz() { return header().tz; }
210  double elev() { return header().elev; }
211 
212  // virtual functions specific to weather data source
214  virtual bool has_data_column(size_t id) = 0;
215 
217  virtual bool read( weather_record *r ) = 0;
218 
219 
220  // some helper methods for ease of use of this class
221  virtual weather_header &header() {
222  if ( !m_hdrInitialized )
223  m_hdrInitialized = header( &m_hdr );
224 
225  return m_hdr;
226  }
227 };
228 
229 class weatherfile : public weather_data_provider
230 {
231 private:
232  int m_type;
233  std::string m_file;
234 
235  struct column
236  {
237  int index; // used for wfcsv to get column index in CSV file from which to read
238  std::vector<float> data;
239  };
240  column m_columns[_MAXCOL_];
241 
242 public:
243  weatherfile();
244  /* Detects file format, read header information, detects which data columns are available and at what index
245  and read weather record information.
246  Calculates twet if missing*/
247  weatherfile( const std::string &file, bool header_only = false );
248  virtual ~weatherfile();
249 
250  void reset();
251  enum { INVALID, TMY2, TMY3, EPW, SMW, WFCSV };
252  int type();
253  std::string filename();
254 
256  void handle_missing_field(size_t index, int col);
257 
259  bool timeStepChecks(int hdr_step_sec = -1);
260 
261  bool open( const std::string &file, bool header_only = false );
262 
263  bool read( weather_record *r );
264  bool has_data_column( size_t id );
265 
266  static std::string normalize_city( const std::string &in );
267  static bool convert_to_wfcsv( const std::string &input, const std::string &output );
268 
269 };
